SEARCH
Package HumanObject.Doctor

Class Doctor

java.lang.Object
HumanObject.BasePerson
HumanObject.Doctor.Doctor
public class Doctor extends BasePerson
The Doctor class represents a doctor in the system, with functionality for managing appointments, availability, and schedules. Doctors have ongoing, completed, and pending appointments, as well as a weekly schedule of available time slots.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class HumanObject.BasePerson

    DOB, gender, ID, name, role

  • Constructor Details

    • Doctor

      public Doctor(int ID, String Name, Date DOB, Boolean Gender, HashMap<Integer,Boolean[]> dateHashMap)
      Constructs a new Doctor object with the specified ID, name, date of birth, gender, and availability information. This constructor is typically used for initializing a Doctor object from a record in the text file HMS.txt. The role is set to ROLE.DOCTOR.
      Parameters:
      ID - The unique identifier for the doctor.
      Name - The name of the doctor.
      DOB - The date of birth of the doctor.
      Gender - The gender of the doctor, where true represents male and false represents female.
      dateHashMap - A HashMap<Integer, Boolean[]> representing the doctor's availability. The key is an integer date (e.g., in YYYYMMDD format), and the value is an array of booleans indicating availability for different time slots.

      This constructor also initializes the following internal lists:

      • Ongoing - An AppointmentList for managing ongoing appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Completed - An AppointmentList for managing completed appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Pending - An AppointmentList for managing pending appointments, initialized to an empty list.

    • Doctor

      public Doctor(String Name, Date DOB, Boolean Gender)
      Constructs a new Doctor object with the specified name, date of birth, and gender. This constructor automatically assigns a unique ID by incrementing lastID, ensuring each doctor has a distinct identifier. It is typically used when creating new Doctor objects that will be added to the text file HMS.txt. The role is set to ROLE.DOCTOR.
      Parameters:
      Name - The name of the doctor.
      DOB - The date of birth of the doctor.
      Gender - The gender of the doctor, where true represents male and false represents female.

      This constructor also initializes the following:

      • availability - A HashMap<Integer, Boolean[]> initialized to an empty map, representing the doctor's availability for appointments.
      • Ongoing - An AppointmentList for managing ongoing appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Completed - An AppointmentList for managing completed appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Pending - An AppointmentList for managing pending appointments, initialized to an empty list.

  • Method Details

    • createTimeSlot

      public void createTimeSlot(Date date)
      Creates a time slot array for the specified date, initializing all slots to unavailable (false).
      Parameters:
      date - The date to add to the availability map with initial unavailability.

    • addTimeSlot

      public void addTimeSlot(Date date, int time)
      Marks a specific time slot on a given date as unavailable.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to set the availability.
      time - The index of the time slot to mark as available.

    • getTimeSlot

      public Boolean[] getTimeSlot(Date date)
      Retrieves the availability for a given date.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to check availability.
      Returns:
      A Boolean array representing time slots for the date, or null if no availability is set.

    • removeTimeSlot

      public boolean removeTimeSlot(Date date, int time)
      Marks a specific time slot as available if it is currently unavailable.
      Parameters:
      date - The date of the appointment.
      time - The index of the time slot to be removed.
      Returns:
      True if the time slot was successfully removed, otherwise false.

    • printFirstWeekTimeSlot

      public void printFirstWeekTimeSlot()
      Prints the unavailability schedule for the doctor for the first week from the current date. Each day shows specific unavailable time slots.

    • setLastID

      public static void setLastID(int ID)
      Sets the last assigned doctor ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - the new value to set as the last assigned doctor ID.

    • getLastID

      public static int getLastID()
      Retrieves the last assigned doctor ID.
      Returns:
      the most recently assigned doctor ID.

    • getOngoingApt

      public AppointmentList getOngoingApt()
      Retrieves the list of ongoing appointments for the doctor.
      Returns:
      the AppointmentList containing the ongoing appointments.

    • getCompletedApt

      public AppointmentList getCompletedApt()
      Retrieves the list of completed appointments for the doctor.
      Returns:
      the AppointmentList containing the completed appointments.

    • getPendingApt

      public AppointmentList getPendingApt()
      Retrieves the list of pending appointments for the doctor.
      Returns:
      the AppointmentList containing the pending appointments.

    • getAvailability

      public HashMap<Integer,Boolean[]> getAvailability()
      Retrieves the availability schedule of the doctor.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where the key is an integer representing the day and the value is a Boolean[] indicating availability for different time slots on that day.
